BuiltInExtension.name: debug
desc: This is used to enable or disable debug mode

params.name: bool
params.desc: true to enable debug mode, false to disable debug mode

BuiltInExtension.name: eval
desc: This is used to evaluate a string as code.
This will not inherit imports that are in the parent script

params.name: code
params.desc: the code to evaluate

BuiltInExtension.name: experimental
desc: This is used to enable or disable experimental mode

params.name: bool
params.desc: true to enable experimental mode, false to disable experimental mode

BuiltInExtension.name: getArucasVersion
desc: This is used to get the version of Arucas that is currently running

returns.desc: the version of Arucas that is currently running

BuiltInExtension.name: getDate
desc: This is used to get the current date formatted with dd/MM/yyyy in your local time

returns.desc: the current date formatted with dd/MM/yyyy

BuiltInExtension.name: getMilliTime
desc: This is used to get the current time in milliseconds

BuiltInExtension.name: getNanoTime
desc: This is used to get the current time in nanoseconds

BuiltInExtension.name: getTime
desc: This is used to get the current time formatted with HH:mm:ss in your local time

returns.desc: the current time formatted with HH:mm:ss

BuiltInExtension.name: getUnixTime
desc: This is used to get the current time in seconds since the Unix epoch

returns.desc: the current time in seconds since the Unix epoch

BuiltInExtension.name: input
desc: This is used to take an input from the user

params.name: prompt
params.desc: the prompt to show the user

BuiltInExtension.name: isDebug
desc: This is used to determine whether the interpreter is in debug mode

BuiltInExtension.name: isExperimental
desc: This is used to determine whether the interpreter is in experimental mode

BuiltInExtension.name: isMain
desc: This is used to check whether the script is the main script

returns.desc: true if the script is the main script, false if it is not

BuiltInExtension.name: len
desc: This is used to get the length of a collection or string

params.name: sizable
params.desc: the collection or string

BuiltInExtension.name: print
desc: This prints a value to the output handler

params.name: printValue
params.desc: the value to print

BuiltInExtension.name: print
desc: This prints a number of values to the console
If there are no arguments then this will print a new line,
other wise it will print the contents without a new line

params.name: printValue...
params.desc: the value to print

BuiltInExtension.name: printDebug
desc: This logs something to the debug output.
It only prints if debug mode is enabled: `debug(true)`

params.name: printValue
params.desc: the value to print

BuiltInExtension.name: random
desc: This is used to generate a random integer between 0 and the bound

params.name: bound
params.desc: the maximum bound (exclusive)

BuiltInExtension.name: range
desc: This is used to generate a range of integers starting from 0, incrementing by 1

params.name: bound
params.desc: the maximum bound (exclusive)

returns.desc: an iterable object that returns the range of integers

BuiltInExtension.name: range
desc: This is used to generate a range of numbers starting
from a start value and ending at a bound value incrementing by 1

params.name: start
params.desc: the start value

params.name: bound
params.desc: the maximum bound (exclusive)

returns.desc: an iterable object that returns the range of integers

BuiltInExtension.name: range
desc: This is used to generate a range of numbers starting from a
start value and ending at a bound value incrementing by a step value

params.name: start
params.desc: the start value

params.name: bound
params.desc: the maximum bound (exclusive)

params.name: step
params.desc: the step value

returns.desc: an iterable object that returns the range of integers

BuiltInExtension.name: run
desc: This is used to run a .arucas file, you can use on script to run other scripts

params.name: path
params.desc: as a file path

returns.desc: any value that the file returns

BuiltInExtension.name: runFromString
desc: This is used to evaluate a string as code.
This will not inherit imports that are in the parent script

params.name: code
params.desc: the code to run

BuiltInExtension.name: sleep
desc: This pauses your program for a certain amount of milliseconds

params.name: milliseconds
params.desc: milliseconds to sleep

BuiltInExtension.name: stop
desc: This is used to stop a script

BuiltInExtension.name: suppressDeprecated
desc: This is used to enable or disable suppressing deprecation warnings

params.name: bool
params.desc: true to enable, false to disable warnings

Boolean.name: Boolean
desc: This is the boolean type, representing either true or false.
This class cannot be instantiated, or extended

Collection.name: Collection
desc: This class is used to represent a collection of objects,
this class is used internally as the parent of maps, lists, and sets.
This cannot be instantiated directly.
All collections inherit Iterable, and thus can be iterated over
This creates a collection, this cannot be called directly, only from child classes

methods.name: isEmpty
desc: This allows you to check if the collection is empty

returns.desc: true if the collection is empty

methods.name: size
desc: This allows you to get the size of the collection

Enum.name: Enum
desc: This class is the super class of all enums in Arucas.
Enums cannot be instantiated or extended

methods.name: getName
desc: This allows you to get the name of an enum value

returns.desc: the name of the enum value

methods.name: ordinal
desc: This allows you to get the ordinal of the enum value

returns.desc: the ordinal of the enum value

Error.name: Error
desc: This class is used for errors, and this is the only type that can be thrown.
You are able to extend this class to create your own error types
This creates a new Error value with no message
This creates a new Error value with the given details as a message

params.name: details
params.desc: the details of the error

desc: This creates a new Error value with the given details as a message and the given value

params.name: details
params.desc: the details of the error

params.name: value
params.desc: the value that is related to the error

methods.name: getDetails
desc: This returns the raw message of the error

methods.name: getStackTraceString
desc: This prints the stack trace of this error

returns.desc: the stack trace converted to a string

methods.name: getValue
desc: This returns the value that is related to the error

returns.desc: the value that is related to the error

File.name: File
desc: This class allows you to read and write files
This creates a new File object with set path

params.name: path
params.desc: the path of the file

methods.name: createDirectory
desc: This creates all parent directories of the file if they don't already exist

returns.desc: true if the directories were created

methods.name: delete
desc: This deletes the file

returns.desc: true if the file was deleted

methods.name: exists
desc: This returns if the file exists

methods.name: getAbsolutePath
desc: This returns the absolute path of the file

returns.desc: the absolute path of the file

methods.name: getName
desc: This returns the name of the file

methods.name: getPath
desc: This returns the path of the file

methods.name: getSubFiles
desc: This returns a list of all the sub files in the directory

returns.desc: a list of all the sub files in the directory

methods.name: open
desc: This opens the file (as in opens it on your os)

methods.name: read
desc: This reads the file and returns the contents as a string

methods.name: resolve
desc: This gets a resolves file object from the current one

params.name: filePath
params.desc: the relative file path

methods.name: write
desc: This writes a string to a file

params.name: string
params.desc: the string to write to the file

static_methods.name: getDirectory
desc: This returns the file of user directory

returns.desc: the file of the working directory

Function.name: Function
desc: This class is used for functions, and this is the only type that can be called.
You are able to extend this class and implement an 'invoke' method to create
your own function types, this class cannot be instantiated directly
This creates a function, this cannot be called directly, only from child classes

Future.name: Future
desc: This class is used to represent values that are in the future.
More precisely values that are being evaluated on another thread,
this allows you to access those values once they've been processed

methods.name: await
desc: This blocks the current thread until the future has
been completed and then returns the value of the future

methods.name: isComplete
desc: This returns whether the future has been completed

returns.desc: Whether the future has been completed

static_methods.name: completed
desc: This returns a future that with a complete value

params.name: value
params.desc: The value to complete the future with

returns.desc: The future that has been completed with the value

Iterable.name: Iterable
desc: This class represents an object that can be iterated over.
This class is used internally to denote whether an object can be
iterated over inside a foreach loop
This creates an iterable, this cannot be called directly, only from child classes

methods.name: iterator
desc: This gets the generated iterator

Iterator.name: Iterator
desc: This class represents an object that iterates.
This is what is used internally to iterate in a
foreach loop and you can create your own iterators
to use be able to use them inside a foreach
This creates an iterator, this cannot be called directly, only from child classes

methods.name: hasNext
desc: Checks whether the iterator has a next item to iterate

returns.desc: whether there are items left to iterate

methods.name: next
desc: Gets the next item in the iterator, may throw if there is no next item

Java.name: Java
desc: This class wraps Java values allowing for interactions between Java and Arucas.
This class cannot be instantiated or extended but you can create Java values by
using the static method 'Java.valueOf()' to convert Arucas to Java

methods.name: callMethod
deprecated: You should call the method directly on the value: Java.valueOf('').isBlank();
desc: This calls the specified method with the specified parameters, calling the method
with this function has no benefits unless you are calling a function that also is
native to Arucas. For example `object.copy()` will use the Arucas 'copy' function.
But this is extremely rare so almost all of the time you should all the method normally.

params.name: methodName
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameters...
params.desc: the parameters to call the method with

returns.desc: the return value of the method call wrapped in the Java wrapper

methods.name: getField
deprecated: You should call the method directly on the value: `Java.constructClass('me.senseiwells.impl.Test').A;`
desc: This returns the Java wrapped value of the specified field.
There is no reason for you to be using this method, it will be removed in future versions

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: the name of the field

returns.desc: the Java wrapped value of the field

methods.name: getMethodDelegate
deprecated: Consider wrapping the method in a lambda instead
desc: This returns a method delegate for the specified method name and parameters.
This should be avoided and replaced with a Arucas function wrapping the call instead.
For example: `delegate = (fun() { Java.valueOf('').isBlank(); });`.
Another thing to note is that the parameter count parameter is no longer
used and ignored internally, instead the parameters are calculated when you
call the delegate. The parameter remains for backwards compatability.

params.name: methodName
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameters
params.desc: the number of parameters

returns.desc: the function containing the Java method delegate

methods.name: setField
deprecated: You should assign the value directly on the value: Java.constructClass('me.senseiwells.impl.Test').A = 'Hello';
desc: This sets the specified field to the specified value
There is no reason for you to be using this method, it will be removed in future versions

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: the name of the field

params.name: value
params.desc: the value to set the field to, the value type must match the type of the field

methods.name: toArucas
desc: This converts the Java value to an Arucas Value if possible, this may still
be of a Java value if it cannot be converted. For example, Strings, Numbers, Lists
will be converted but

returns.desc: the Value in Arucas, this may still be of Java value if the value cannot be converted into an Arucas value, values like Strings, Numbers, Lists, etc... will be converted

static_methods.name: arrayOf
desc: Creates a Java Object array with a given values, this will be the size of the array,
this cannot be used to create primitive arrays

params.name: values...
params.desc: the values to add to the array

static_methods.name: booleanArray
desc: Creates a Java boolean array with a given size, the array is filled with false
by default and can be filled with only booleans

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: booleanOf
desc: Creates a Java value boolean, to be used in Java

params.name: bool
params.desc: the boolean to convert to a Java boolean

static_methods.name: byteArray
desc: Creates a Java byte array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only bytes

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: byteOf
desc: Creates a Java value byte, to be used in Java

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java byte

static_methods.name: callStaticMethod
deprecated: You should use 'Java.classOf(name)' then call the static method
desc: Calls a static method of a Java class.
This should be avoided and instead use 'classOf' to get the
instance of the class then call the static method on that

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: methodName
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameters...
params.desc: any parameters to call the method with

returns.desc: the return value of the method wrapped in the Java wrapper

static_methods.name: charArray
desc: Creates a Java char array with a given size, the array is filled with null characters's
by default and can be filled with only chars

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: charOf
desc: Creates a Java value char, to be used in Java

params.name: char
params.desc: the char to convert to a Java char

static_methods.name: classFromName
desc: Gets a Java class from the name of the class

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class you want to get

returns.desc: the Java Class<?> value wrapped in the Java wrapper

static_methods.name: classOf
desc: Gets a Java class from the name of the class

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class you want to get

returns.desc: the Java class value which can be used as a class reference

static_methods.name: constructClass
deprecated: You should use 'Java.classOf(name)' then call the result to construct the class
desc: This constructs a Java class with specified class name and parameters.
This should be avoided and instead use 'classOf' to get the class
instance then call the constructor on that instance

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: parameters...
params.desc: any parameters to pass to the constructor

returns.desc: the constructed Java Object wrapped in the Java wrapper

static_methods.name: consumerOf
desc: Creates a Java Consumer object from a given function, it must have one
parameter and any return values will be ignored

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to be executed

static_methods.name: doubleArray
desc: Creates a Java double array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only doubles

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: doubleOf
desc: Creates a Java value double, to be used in Java

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java double

static_methods.name: floatArray
desc: Creates a Java float array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only floats

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: floatOf
desc: Creates a Java value float, to be used in Java

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java float

static_methods.name: functionOf
desc: Creates a Java Function object from a given function

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to be executed, this must have one parameter and must return a value

static_methods.name: getStaticField
deprecated: You should use 'Java.classOf(name)' then access the static field
desc: Gets a static field Java value from a Java class

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: the name of the field

returns.desc: the Java value of the field wrapped in the Java wrapper

static_methods.name: getStaticMethodDelegate
deprecated: You should use 'Java.classOf(name)' then wrap the static method
desc: Gets a static method delegate from a Java class, this should
be avoided and instance use 'classOf' to get the class instance
and then call the method on that class instance. The parameter count
parameter is no longer used internally but remains for backwards compatibility

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: methodName
params.desc: the name of the method

params.name: parameters
params.desc: the number of parameters

returns.desc: the delegated Java method in an Arucas Function

static_methods.name: intArray
desc: Creates a Java int array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only ints

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: intOf
desc: Creates a Java value int, to be used in Java

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java int

static_methods.name: longArray
desc: Creates a Java long array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only longs

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: longOf
desc: Creates a Java value long, to be used in Java

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java long

static_methods.name: objectArray
desc: Creates a Java Object array with a given size, the array is filled with null values
by default and can be filled with any Java values, this array cannot be expanded

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: predicateOf
desc: Creates a Java Predicate object from a given function

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to be executed, this must have one parameter and must return a boolean

static_methods.name: runnableOf
desc: Creates a Java Runnable object from a given function, this must
have no paramters and any return values will be ignored

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to be executed

static_methods.name: setStaticField
deprecated: You should use 'Java.classOf(name)' then assign the static field
desc: Sets a static field in a Java class with a new value

params.name: className
params.desc: the name of the class

params.name: fieldName
params.desc: the name of the field

params.name: newValue
params.desc: the new value

examples:
// Obviously this won't work, but it's just an example
Java.setStaticField('java.lang.Integer', 'MAX_VALUE', Java.intOf(100));"

static_methods.name: shortArray
desc: Creates a Java short array with a given size, the array is filled with 0's
by default and can be filled with only shorts

params.name: size
params.desc: the size of the array

static_methods.name: shortOf
desc: Creates a Java value short, to be used in Java

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to convert to a Java short

static_methods.name: supplierOf
desc: Creates a Java Supplier object from a given function

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to be executed, this must have no parameters and must return (supply) a value

static_methods.name: valueOf
desc: Converts any Arucas value into a Java value then wraps it in the Java wrapper and returns it

params.name: value
params.desc: any value to get the Java value of

returns.desc: the Java wrapper value, null if argument was null

JavaClass.name: JavaClass
desc: This class 'acts' as a Java class. You are able to call this class which
will invoke the Java class' constructor, and access and assign the static
fields of the class. This class cannot be instantiated or extended.

Json.name: Json
desc: This class allows you to create and manipulate JSON objects.
This class cannot be instantiated or extended

methods.name: getValue
desc: This converts the Json back into an object

returns.desc: the Value parsed from the Json

methods.name: writeToFile
desc: This writes the Json to a file
if the file given is a directory or cannot be
written to, an error will be thrown

params.name: file
params.desc: the file that you want to write to

static_methods.name: fromFile
desc: This will read a file and parse it into a Json, this will throw an error if the file cannot be read

params.name: file
params.desc: the file that you want to parse into a Json

returns.desc: the Json parsed from the file

static_methods.name: fromList
desc: This converts a list into a Json, an important thing to note is that
any values that are not Numbers, Booleans, Lists, Maps, or Null will use their
toString() member to convert them to a string

params.name: list
params.desc: the list that you want to parse into a Json

returns.desc: the Json parsed from the list

static_methods.name: fromMap
desc: This converts a map into a Json, an important thing to note is that
any values that are not Numbers, Booleans, Lists, Maps, or Null will use their
toString() member to convert them to a string

params.name: map
params.desc: the map that you want to parse into a Json

returns.desc: the Json parsed from the map

static_methods.name: fromString
desc: This converts a string into a Json provided it is formatted correctly,
otherwise throwing an error

params.name: string
params.desc: the string that you want to parse into a Json

returns.desc: the Json parsed from the string

List.name: List
desc: This class is used for collections of ordered elements
This creates a list, this cannot be called directly, only from child classes

methods.name: addAll
desc: This allows you to add all the values in another collection to the list

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection you want to add to the list

methods.name: append
desc: This allows you to append a value to the end of the list

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to append

methods.name: clear
desc: This allows you to clear the list

methods.name: contains
desc: This allows you to check if the list contains a specific value

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to check

returns.desc: true if the list contains the value

methods.name: containsAll
desc: This allows you to check if the list contains all the values in another collection

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection you want to check agains

returns.desc: true if the list contains all the values in the collection

methods.name: filter
desc: This filters the list using the predicate, a function that either returns
true or false, based on the element on whether it should be kept or not,
and returns a new list with the filtered elements

params.name: predicate
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns Boolean

methods.name: flatten
desc: If there are any objects in the list that are collections they will
be expanded and added to the list. However collections inside those
collections will not be flattened, this is returned as a new list

methods.name: get
desc: This allows you to get the value at a specific index, alternative to bracket accessor,
this will throw an error if the index given is out of bounds

params.name: index
params.desc: the index of the value you want to get

methods.name: indexOf
desc: This allows you to get the index of a specific value

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to get the index of

methods.name: insert
desc: This allows you to insert a value at a specific index, this will throw an error if the index is out of bounds

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to insert

params.name: index
params.desc: the index you want to insert the value at

methods.name: lastIndexOf
desc: This allows you to get the last index of a specific value

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to get the last index of

returns.desc: the last index of the value

methods.name: map
desc: This maps the list using the mapper, a function that takes a value and
returns a new value, and returns a new list with the mapped elements

params.name: mapper
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns a new value

methods.name: prepend
desc: This allows you to prepend a value to the beginning of the list

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to prepend

methods.name: reduce
desc: This reduces the list using the reducer, a function that takes an
accumulated value and a new value and returns the next accumulated value

params.name: reducer
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns a new value

methods.name: reduce
desc: This reduces the list using the reducer starting with an identity

params.name: identity
params.desc: the identity

params.name: reducer
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns a new value

methods.name: remove
desc: This allows you to remove the value at a specific index, alternative to bracket assignment.
This will throw an error if the index is out of bounds

params.name: index
params.desc: the index of the value you want to remove

methods.name: removeAll
desc: This allows you to remove all the values in another collection from the list

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection you want to remove from the list

methods.name: retainAll
desc: This allows you to retain only the values that are in both lists

params.name: list
params.desc: the list you want to retain values from

methods.name: reverse
desc: This allows you to reverse the list

methods.name: set
desc: This allows you to set the value at a specific index, alternative to bracket assignment,
this will throw an erroor if the index given is out of bounds

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to set

params.name: index
params.desc: the index you want to set the value at

methods.name: shuffle
desc: This allows you to shuffle the list

methods.name: sort
desc: This allows you to sort the list using the elements compare method

methods.name: sort
desc: This allows you to sort the list using a comparator function

params.name: comparator
params.desc: the comparator function

Map.name: Map
desc: This class is used to create a map of objects, using keys and values.
This class cannot be directly instantiated, but can be extended to create a map of your own type.
This creates an empty map, this cannot be called directly, only from child classes

methods.name: clear
desc: This allows you to clear the map of all the keys and values

methods.name: containsKey
desc: This allows you to check if the map contains a specific key

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to check

returns.desc: true if the map contains the key, false otherwise

methods.name: containsValue
desc: This allows you to check if the map contains a specific value

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to check

returns.desc: true if the map contains the value, false otherwise

methods.name: get
desc: This allows you to get the value of a key in the map

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to get the value of

returns.desc: the value of the key, will return null if non-existent

methods.name: getKeys
desc: This allows you to get the keys in the map

returns.desc: a complete list of all the keys

methods.name: getValues
desc: This allows you to get the values in the map

returns.desc: a complete list of all the values

methods.name: map
desc: This allows you to map the values in the map and returns a new map

params.name: remapper
params.desc: the function you want to map the values with

returns.desc: a new map with the mapped values

methods.name: put
desc: This allows you to put a key and value in the map

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to put

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to put

returns.desc: the previous value associated with the key, null if none

methods.name: putAll
desc: This allows you to put all the keys and values of another map into this map

params.name: another map
params.desc: the map you want to merge into this map

methods.name: putIfAbsent
desc: This allows you to put a key and value in the map if it doesn't exist

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to put

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to put

methods.name: remove
desc: This allows you to remove a key and its value from the map

params.name: key
params.desc: the key you want to remove

returns.desc: the value associated with the key, null if none

static_methods.name: unordered
desc: This function allows you to create an unordered map

Math.name: Math
desc: Provides many basic math functions. This is a utility class, and cannot be constructed

static_members.name: e
desc: The value of e

static_members.name: pi
desc: The value of pi

static_members.name: root2
desc: The value of root 2

static_methods.name: abs
desc: Returns the absolute value of a number

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to get the absolute value of

returns.desc: the absolute value of the number

static_methods.name: arccos
desc: Returns the arc cosine of a number

params.name: num
params.desc: the number to get the arc cosine of

returns.desc: the arc cosine of the number

static_methods.name: arcsin

static_methods.name: arctan

static_methods.name: arctan2
desc: Returns the angle theta of the polar coordinates (r, theta) that correspond to the rectangular
coordinates (x, y) by computing the arc tangent of the value y / x

params.name: y
params.desc: the ordinate coordinate

params.name: x
params.desc: the abscissa coordinate

returns.desc: the theta component of the point (r, theta)

Network.name: Network
desc: Allows you to do http requests. This is a utility class and cannot be constructed.

static_methods.name: downloadFile
desc: Downloads a file from an url to a file

params.name: url
params.desc: the url to download from

params.name: file
params.desc: the file to download to

static_methods.name: openUrl
desc: Opens an url in the default browser

params.name: url
params.desc: the url to open

static_methods.name: requestUrl
desc: Requests an url and returns the response

params.name: url
params.desc: the url to request

Null.name: Null
desc: This class is used for the null object,
this cannot be instantiated or extended

Number.name: Number
desc: This class cannot be constructed as it has a literal representation.
For math related functions see the Math class.

methods.name: ceil
desc: This allows you to round a number up to the nearest integer

methods.name: floor
desc: This allows you to round a number down to the nearest integer

methods.name: isInfinite
desc: This allows you to check if a number is infinite

returns.desc: true if the number is infinite

methods.name: isNaN
desc: This allows you to check if a number is not a number

returns.desc: true if the number is not a number

methods.name: round
desc: This allows you to round a number to the nearest integer

Object.name: Object
desc: This is the base class for every other class in Arucas.
This class cannot be instantiated from, you can extend it
however every class already extends this class by default

methods.name: copy
desc: This returns a copy of the value if implemented.
Some objects that are immutable, such as Strings and Numbers
will not be copied, and will return the same instance.
Any object that has not implemented the copy method will also
return the same instance

methods.name: hashCode
desc: This returns the hash code of the value, mainly used for maps and sets
the hash code of an object must remain consistent for objects to be able
to be used as keys in a map or set. If two objects are equal, they must
have the same hash code

returns.desc: the hash code of the value

methods.name: instanceOf
desc: This returns true if the value is an instance of the given type

params.name: type
params.desc: the type to check against

returns.desc: true if the value is an instance of the given type

methods.name: toString
desc: This returns the string representation of the value

returns.desc: the string representation of the value

methods.name: uniqueHash
desc: This returns the unique hash of the value, this is different for every instance of a value

returns.desc: the unique hash of the value

Set.name: Set
desc: Sets are collections of unique values. Similar to maps, without the values.
An instance of the class can be created by using `Set.of(values...)`
This creates an empty set

methods.name: add
desc: This allows you to add a value to the set

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to add to the set

returns.desc: whether the value was successfully added to the set

methods.name: addAll
desc: This allows you to add all the values in a collection into the set

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection of values you want to add

methods.name: clear
desc: This removes all values from inside the set

methods.name: contains
desc: This allows you to check whether a value is in the set

params.name: value
params.desc: the value that you want to check in the set

returns.desc: whether the value is in the set

methods.name: containsAll
desc: This allows you to check whether a collection of values are all in the set

params.name: collection
params.desc: the collection of values you want to check in the set

returns.desc: whether all the values are in the set

methods.name: filter
desc: This allows you to filter the set

params.name: function
params.desc: the function you want to filter the set by

methods.name: get
desc: This allows you to get a value from in the set.
The reason this might be useful is if you want to retrieve something
from the set that will have the same hashcode but be in a different state
as the value you are passing in

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to get from the set

returns.desc: the value you wanted to get, null if it wasn't in the set

methods.name: map
desc: This allows you to map the set

params.name: function
params.desc: the function you want to map the set by

methods.name: reduce
desc: This allows you to reduce the set

params.name: function
params.desc: the function you want to reduce the set by

methods.name: reduce
desc: This reduces the list using the reducer starting with an identity

params.name: identity
params.desc: the identity

params.name: reducer
params.desc: a function that takes a value and returns a new value

examples: Set.of(-9, 81, 96, 15).reduce("", fun(value, next) { return value + next; });

methods.name: remove
desc: This allows you to remove a value from the set

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to remove from the set

returns.desc: whether the value was removed from the set

methods.name: removeAll
desc: This allows you to remove all values in a collection from the set

params.name: value
params.desc: the values you want to remove from the set

returns.desc: the set with the values removed

methods.name: toList
desc: This returns a list of all the values in the set

returns.desc: the list of values in the set

static_methods.name: of
desc: This allows you to create a set with an arbitrary number of values

params.name: values...
params.desc: the values you want to add to the set

static_methods.name: unordered
desc: This creates an unordered set

String.name: String
desc: This class represents an array of characters to form a string.
This class cannot be instantiated directly, instead use the literal
by using quotes. Strings are immutable in Arucas.
This creates a new string object, not from the string pool, with the given string.
This cannot be called directly, only from child classes

methods.name: capitalize
desc: This returns the string in capitalized form

methods.name: chars
desc: This makes a list of all the characters in the string

methods.name: contains
desc: This returns whether the string contains the given string

params.name: string
params.desc: the string to check

returns.desc: whether the string contains the given string

methods.name: endsWith
desc: This returns whether the string ends with the given string

params.name: string
params.desc: the string to check

returns.desc: whether the string ends with the given string

methods.name: find
desc: This finds all matches of the regex in the string,
this does not find groups, for that use `<String>.findGroups(regex)`

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex to search the string with

returns.desc: the list of all instances of the regex in the string

methods.name: findAll
desc: This finds all matches and groups of a regex in the matches in the string
the first group of each match will be the complete match and following
will be the groups of the regex, a group may be empty if it doesn't exist

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex to search the string with

returns.desc: a list of match groups, which is a list containing matches

methods.name: format
desc: This formats the string using the given arguments.
This internally uses the Java String.format() method.
For how to use see here: https://www.javatpoint.com/java-string-format

params.name: objects...
params.desc: the objects to insert

methods.name: length
desc: This returns the length of the string

methods.name: lowercase
desc: This returns the string in lowercase

methods.name: matches
desc: This returns whether the string matches the given regex

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex to match the string with

returns.desc: whether the string matches the given regex

methods.name: replaceAll
desc: This replaces all the instances of a regex with the replace string

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex you want to replace

params.name: replacement
params.desc: the string you want to replace it with

methods.name: replaceFirst
desc: This replaces the first instance of a regex with the replace string

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex you want to replace

params.name: replacement
params.desc: the string you want to replace it with

methods.name: reverse
desc: This returns the string in reverse

methods.name: split
desc: This splits the string into a list of strings based on a regex

params.name: regex
params.desc: the regex to split the string with

methods.name: startsWith
desc: This returns whether the string starts with the given string

params.name: string
params.desc: the string to check

returns.desc: whether the string starts with the given string

methods.name: strip
desc: This strips the whitespace from the string

methods.name: subString
desc: This returns a substring of the string

params.name: from
params.desc: the start index (inclusive)

params.name: to
params.desc: the end index (exclusive)

methods.name: toList
desc: This makes a list of all the characters in the string

methods.name: toNumber
desc: This tries to convert the string to a number.
This method can convert hex or denary into numbers.
If the string is not a number, it will throw an error

methods.name: uppercase
desc: This returns the string in uppercase

Task.name: Task
desc: This class is used to create tasks that can be chained and
run asynchronously. Tasks can be executed as many times as needed
and chained tasks will be executed in the order they are created.
This creates a new empty task

methods.name: run
desc: This runs the task asynchronously and returns a future which can be awaited.
The last function in the task will be used as the return value for the future

returns.desc: the future value that can be awaited

examples:
task = new Task()
    .then(fun() print("hello"))
    .then(fun() print(" "))
    .then(fun() print("world"))
    .then(fun() 10);
f = task.run(); // prints 'hello world'
print(f.await()); // prints 10

methods.name: then
desc: This adds a function to the end of the current task.
If this is the last function in the task then the return
value of the function will be the return value of the task.

params.name: function
params.desc: the function to run at the end of the task

returns.desc: the task, this allows for chaining

examples:
task = new Task()
    .then(fun() print("hello"))
    .then(fun() print(" "))
    .then(fun() print("world"))
    .then(fun() 10);
f = task.run(); // prints 'hello world'
print(f.await()); // prints 10

Thread.name: Thread
desc: This class allows to to create threads for async executions.
This class cannot be instantiated or extended. To create a new
thread use the static method 'Thread.runThreaded()'

methods.name: freeze
desc: This serves the same purpose as 'Thread.freeze()' however this works on the current
thread instance, unlike 'Thread.freeze()' this cannot throw an error.

methods.name: getAge
desc: This gets the age of the thread in milliseconds

methods.name: getName
desc: This gets the name of the thread

methods.name: isAlive
desc: This checks if the thread is alive (still running)

returns.desc: true if the thread is alive, false if not

methods.name: stop
desc: This stops the thread from executing, anything that was running will be instantly stopped.
This method will fail if the thread is not alive

methods.name: thaw
desc: This will thaw the thread from its frozen state, if the thread is not frozen then an
error will be thrown

static_methods.name: freeze
desc: This freezes the current thread, stops anything else from executing on the thread.
This may fail if you try to freeze a non Arucas Thread in which case an error will be thrown

static_methods.name: getCurrentThread
desc: This gets the current thread that the code is running on,
this may throw an error if the thread is not safe to get,
which happens when running outside of Arucas Threads

static_methods.name: runThreaded
desc: This starts a new thread and runs a function on it, the thread will
terminate when it finishes executing the function, threads will stop automatically
when the program stops, you are also able to stop threads by using the Thread object

params.name: function
params.desc: the function you want to run on a new thread

static_methods.name: runThreaded
desc: This starts a new thread with a specific name and runs a function on it

params.name: name
params.desc: the name of the thread

params.name: function
params.desc: the function you want to run on a new thread

Type.name: Type
desc: This class lets you get the type of another class

methods.name: getName
desc: This gets the name of the type

methods.name: inheritsFrom
desc: This checks whether a type is a subtype of another type

params.name: type
params.desc: the other type you want to check against

returns.desc: whether the type is of that type

static_methods.name: of
desc: This gets the specific type of a value

params.name: value
params.desc: the value you want to get the type of
